level.text: A certified nurse-midwife is a registered nurse prepared in a formal educational program to assume an expanded role in providing health care in the area of nurse-midwifery services. Certified nurse-midwives, when functioning within the authorized scope of practice, are qualified to assume primary responsibility for the care of their patients. This practice incorporates the use of independent judgment as well as collaborative interaction with physicians or osteopaths.
Chapters 40 (Health Occupations: General Rules), 41 (Health Occupations: Administrative Procedures), and 54 (Registered Nursing) of this title shall supplement this chapter.

level.heading: AUTHORITY
level.text: Unless otherwise noted, the authority for this chapter is ยง 302(14) of the District of Columbia Health Occupations Revision Act of 1985, D.C. Law 6-99, D.C. Code ยง 2-3303.2(14) (1988 Repl. Vol.), 33 DCR 729, 732 (February 7, 1986), and Mayor’s Order 86-110, 33 DCR 5220 (August 22, 1986).

level.heading: SOURCE
level.text: Final Rulemaking published at 36 DCR 3497 (May 12, 1989); and amended by Final Rulemaking published at 49 DCR 11751 (December 27, 2002).
